data.title: How to Install Clementine Music Player on Windows?
data.meta_description: A Computer Science portal for geeks. It contains well written, well thought and well explained computer science and programming articles, quizzes and practice/competitive programming/company interview Questions.
data.text:
A free and open-source audio player is Clementine. Amarok 1.4 has been ported to the Qt 4 and GStreamer multimedia frameworks. It is offered for Windows, macOS, and Unix-like operating systems. The GPL 3.0 or later is the license that governs the release of Clementine. Clementine was developed as a result of Amarok’s upgrade from version 1.4 to version 2, as well as the associated focus change that many users found objectionable. Clementine’s initial version was released in February 2010. Clementine’s most recent stable release was in 2016, although since then, development has resumed on GitHub, with a number of release candidate versions being made available. A branch of Clementine called Strawberry Music Player was made public in 2018.

Features of Clementine

The album cover, queue manager, and tag editor.

Obtain any missing MusicBrainz tags.

Visualize audio while performing.

Making intelligent, dynamic playlists. Import and export options for tabbed playlists include M3U, XSPF, PLS, ASX, and Cue sheets.

MP3, Ogg (Vorbis, Speex, Opus), FLAC, AAC, or WMA audio encoding.

Search and listen to the local music collection.

Play online radio stations from the servers of Spotify, Grooveshark, SomaFM, Magnatune, Jamendo, SKY.fm, Digitally Imported, JAZZRADIO.com, Soundcloud, Icecast, and Subsonic.

Find and play the music you’ve posted to OneDrive, Box, Dropbox, Google Drive, and others.

Make dynamic and intelligent playlists.

Tabbed playlists, M3U, XSPF, PLS, and ASX import and export capabilities.

CUE sheet assistance.

Play CDs of audio.

Visuals produced by projectM.

Lyrics, bios, and images of the artists.

Make music available in MP3, Ogg Vorbis, Ogg Speex, FLAC, or AAC formats.

Sort your music by tags and edit the tags on MP3 and OGG files.

Obtain any missing MusicBrainz tags.

Find podcasts and download them.

Download any album covers that are missing from Amazon and Last.fm.

System Requirements

Processor: Dual-Core (Intel i5 or AMD Equitant).

RAM: 2GB or Higher.

Video: Windows 7/10/11, Windows 8.x compatible video card.

Sound: Windows 7/10/11, Windows 8.x compatible sound card.

File Size: 40 MB.

Installation of Clementine

Following steps are to be followed in order to install clementine:

Step 1: We will Download the Clementine.exe file in windows using the below link,

https://www.clementine-player.org/

Step 2: Run the.exe file and click the next button.

Step 3: We will choose a location for installing software and click the install button.

Step 4: The installation is started now wait 5 min.

Step 5: The installation is completed now click the finish button to run the software.

The Software is ready to use.

The Software is successfully completed now.
